summary: The H–1B and L–1 Visa Reform Act of 2025 aims to reform and reduce fraud and abuse in visa programs for temporary workers (H-1B and L-1 visas). It modifies application requirements, introduces new requirements for employers, and strengthens investigation and enforcement by the Department of Labor.  The bill also addresses worker displacement, wage standards, and transparency.  Key changes include updated visa allocation, limitations on visa extensions, and increased penalties for violations related to working conditions and retaliatory actions. New reporting requirements are also included.
